## R and Data Science {#r-ds}

#### [**R for Data Science (2e)**](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/) **- Textbook**

> FREE 2nd edition of "R for Data Science" which provides practical skills for data science, including data importation, data structuring, data transformation, and data visualization

#### [**Statistical Inference via Data Science: A ModernDive into R and the Tidyverse**](https://moderndive.com/index.html) **- Textbook**

> The companion website to Chester Ismay and Albert Y. Kim's introductory statistics textbook, which walks students through the entire data analysis pipeline using R and tidyverse

#### [**The Quartz Guide to Bad Data**](https://github.com/Quartz/bad-data-guide) **- Reference**

> This guide presents thorough descriptions and suggested solutions to many of the kinds of problems that you will encounter when working with data.

#### [**R Screencasts**](https://www.rscreencasts.com/) **- Video**

> Live data analysis screencasts from a top Data Scientist, David Robinson

#### [**Tools for Analyzing R Code the Tidy Way**](https://journal.r-project.org/archive/2020/RJ-2020-011/RJ-2020-011.pdf) **- Article**

> An article on two packages, [matahari](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/matahari/matahari.pdf) and [tidycode](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/tidycode/vignettes/tidycode.html), written to analyze R code in a tidy manner

#### [**Tidy Modeling with R**](https://www.tmwr.org/) **- Textbook**

> A guide to using a collection of software in the R programming language for model building calledÂ tidymodels
